section.title: Introduction
section.t: This document contains the initial revision of the iana-dns-zone-types YANG module. This module defines derived types for the common parameters of DNS resource records (RR): class and type. These types, "rr-class" and "rr-type", reflect the IANA registries "DNS CLASSes" and "Resource Record (RR) TYPEs" .
Whenever a new class or RR type is added to the above registries, the iana-dns-zone-types YANG module is also updated by IANA.

section.title: YANG Design Considerations
section.t: The IANA document "Domain Name System (DNS) Parameters" contains altogether thirteen registries. The YANG module iana-dns-zone-types defines derived types corresponding to only two of the registries that are useful for modeling zone data, namely "DNS CLASSes" and "Resource Record (RR) TYPEs". It is expected that other registries in will be similarly reflected in future YANG modules as necessary. This way, an appropriate combination of YANG modules can be chosen depending on which YANG types are needed for a given data modeling purpose.

introduced the option of specifying an RR class or type via its assigned decimal number, as an alternative to specifying the mnemonic name. For example, the "IN" class can be equivalently written as "CLASS1", and "AAAA" type as "TYPE28".

Accordingly, the derived types "rr-class" and "rr-type" are defined in the YANG module as a union of two member types:
16-bit decimal integer ("uint16") mnemonic name, represented by the enumeration type "rr-class-name" and "rr-type-name", respectively.

section.title: IANA Considerations
section.t: RFC Editor: In this section, replace all occurrences of 'XXXX' with the actual RFC number.
This document defines the initial version of the IANA-maintained iana-dns-zone-types YANG module.
The iana-dns-zone-types YANG module is intended to reflect the "DNS CLASSes" and "Resource Record (RR) TYPEs" registries in .
IANA has added this new note to the "iana-dns-zone-types YANG Module" registry:

figure.artwork: Classes and types of DNS resource records must not be directly added to the iana-dns-zone-types YANG module. They must instead be added to the "DNS CLASSes" and "Resource Record (RR) TYPEs" registries, respectively.

section.t:
When a new RR class or type is added to the "DNS CLASSes" or "Resource Record (RR) TYPEs" registry, a new "enum" statement must be added to the "rr-class-name" or "rr-type-name" type, respectively. The assigned name defined by the "enum" statement is the same as the mnemonic name of the new RR class or type. The following substatements to the "enum" statement should be defined:
Use the decimal value from the registry. Include only if a RR class or type registration has been deprecated (use the value "deprecated") or obsoleted (use the value "obsolete"). Replicate the corresponding information from the registry, namely the full name of the new RR class, or the meaning of the new RR type, if any. Replicate the reference from the registry, if any, and add the title of the document, if applicable.
Unassigned or reserved values are not included in the YANG module.
Each time the iana-dns-zone-types YANG module is updated, a new "revision" statement must be added before the existing "revision" statements.
IANA has added this new note to the "DNS CLASSes" and "Resource Record (RR) TYPEs" registries:

section.title: Security Considerations
section.t: This documents translates two IANA registries into YANG data types and otherwise introduces no technology or protocol. Consequently, there are no security issues to be considered for this document.
